meta.content: Front Page; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

block.p: Mexico Deports Cuban A consul at the Cuban Embassy in Mexico City -- a longtime intelligence official who sought political refuge in Mexico -- has been arrested and sent home.
Legal Debate on Drug Tests The Supreme Court heard arguments about the arrest on drug charges of 10 South Carolina women after a hospital tested the urine of maternity patients.
Mexico Deports Cuban A consul at the Cuban Embassy in Mexico City -- a longtime intelligence official who sought political refuge in Mexico -- has been arrested and sent home.
Legal Debate on Drug Tests The Supreme Court heard arguments about the arrest on drug charges of 10 South Carolina women after a hospital tested the urine of maternity patients.
$60 Million for U.S. Library The Library of Congress plans to use its largest single donation to bring together scholars and decision-makers on Capitol Hill.

Correction: October 6, 2000, Friday A front-page contents entry yesterday about a Cuban intelligence official who was seeking refuge in Mexico misstated his relationship to the Cuban Embassy in Mexico City. He was a consul there from 1986 until 1991, not recently.

A front-page contents entry yesterday about a Cuban intelligence official who was seeking refuge in Mexico misstated his relationship to the Cuban Embassy in Mexico City. He was a consul there from 1986 until 1991, not recently.
